page.title: 08Religion.
page.content: Our church is the only anglican church in our area.It was built in year 1869 by Sir Roundell Palmer, Q.C., the 1st Earl of Selborne. Alfred Waterhouse designed the church, and also the vicarage. The village hall next to the church used to be the village school. At first, the attendance varied from 65 children in June and November to 48 in August and 43 in October. The school was a private one only for children from the Blackmoor estate. After the Education Act of 1870 the school was made a Public Elementary School. The school was officially opened on Easter Tuesday, April 11th 1871. The school has now moved to another part of the village. The vicar, the Reverend R.Inkpen, has been at Blackmoor for 16 years. by Sarah Pickford.
